thread.title: Hawks defense pithces third straight shutout in win over Meadowcreek
thread.title_full: Hawks defense pithces third straight shutout in win over Meadowcreek

author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Hawks defense pithces third straight shutout in win over Meadowcreek
text:
By AccessWDUN Staff Related Articles 2015 High school football rankings 2015 High School Football region standings WEEK 6: Playoff, region races shaping up after big night VIDEO: Gainesville makes most of six Salem turnovers to set up Lanier showdown 
HOSCHTON -- The Mill Creek defense just keeps one-upping itself. 
The Hawks pitched their third consecutive shutout and held Meadowcreek to minus-24 yards of offense in 52-0 shellacking at Mill Creek Community Friday night in Region 7- . 
The Hawks got two defensive scores in the first quarter, a 22-yard interception return from Kishawn Miller to open the scoring just moments into the game, and a 6-yard fumble return by Sidney Otiwu. In between, Mill Creek (6-0, 3-0 Region 7- ) got a 4-yard touchdown run from Daniel LeConte and a 22-yard touchdown pass from Cameron Turley to Preston Norwood. Joe Thomas capped the first quarter with a 3-yard scoring run for a 35-0 lead. 
In the second quarter, Brenton King added a 22-yard field goal and Thomas scored his second touchdown, a 34-yard romp, for a 45-0 lead. Tyson Morgan closed out the scoring with a 67-yard touchdown run for the final score. 
Morgan paced the Hawks with 75 yards rushing on six carries. Thomas finished with 66 yards rushing on six carries and LeConte had 41 yards on eight carries in limited action. 
Mill Creek travels to Mountain View next in another 7- battle. Associated Categories : Sports , High School Sports , Friday Game Night Associated Tags : High school football, Mill Creek football Â© Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
